thread.title: Manchester United legend Ryan Giggs believes there are ‘too many foreign managers’ in the Premier League
thread.title_full: Manchester United legend Ryan Giggs believes there are ‘too many foreign managers’ in the Premier League

author: smorgan
title: Manchester United legend Ryan Giggs believes there are ‘too many foreign managers’ in the Premier League
text:
Tony Pulis (West Brom) - Wales 
Slaven Bilic (West Ham) - Croatia 
Giggs, twice linked with the Swansea hotseat, believes there is a wealth of home-grown talent just waiting to be explored. 
He told the BBC : "I don't think there's enough (British managers) at the moment. 
"I think it is (important British coaches get a chance). There's a lot of top quality foreign coaches in the Premier League, but there's also a lot of quality British coaches and managers out there. 
"If you don't get the chance, you don't get the chance to prove what you can do and see what you can do with a talented team. PA:Press Association Ryan Giggs had a brief spell in charge of Manchester United Getty Images The Welsh wizard was assistant to Dutchman Louis van Gaal at Old Trafford Related stories Real Madrid and Paris Saint-Germain in stunning talks to swap Karim Benzema and Edinson Cavani Get shirty Man City fan pretends to be a steward to get hold of Kevin de Bruyne’s shirt… then gets chased off the pitch In for the Kyl Everything you need to know about Monaco's Kylian Mbappe... who is dubbed the 'next Thierry Henry' GOODBYE ROO BY TUESDAY Wayne Rooney ready to quit Man Utd for China NEXT WEEK and become highest paid player in the world in £52million switch Team news West Brom vs Bournemouth team news: Jack Wilshere fit for Cherries but Callum Wilson and Adam Federici out for the season History on Eur side Manchester United would join elite group of giant clubs with Europa League success TV TIMES West Brom vs Bournemouth: What TV channel is it on, what time is kick off and what is the latest team news? EUROPA LIVE St Etienne vs Manchester United LIVE: Follow all the action, updates and team news from the Europa League round of 32 clash TEAM NEWS Saint Etienne vs Manchester United: What is the team news for the Europa League tie? 
"As I say, there are quality foreign coaches as well. 
"I just think on the balance, there's too many foreigners at the moment and British coaches probably just don't get the chances." 
Giggs was caretaker boss at Old Trafford for four games in 2014 after Sir Alex Ferguson's successor David Moyes was sacked.
